instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924A: What is 820-4924A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a non-working keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
Macbook keyboard and trackpad not working in OSx

A client brought me a Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a non-working keyboard and trackpad, but when I decided to test them in another OSs (Linux MX and HBCD in my case) and they work perfectly.

I tested them in High Sierra and Big Sur in safe mode but they didn't work.

Another thing that is happening is that the keyboard is not working on pre-boot, meaning that I can't reset the NVRAM, or even use ALT to boot into another OS, I've been using an extenral keyboard this whole time. The only key combination that is working is SHIFT+CONTROL+OPTION to reset the SMC, but I think that it's working becuse the Macbook is off, as soon as I turn it on, nothing works.

Yes, I've already reset the NVRAM with the external keyboard, and re-seated the keyboard flex and trackpad ribbon and still nothing.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a non-working keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
Please correct the typo; no need to repeat the post.
You may also post the 820-xxxx board code at same time...

threads.message:

[/QUOTE]
Sorry about that. Did not notice it. Fixed.

The board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a non-working keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
The strange thing is the KB/TP don't work before, nor after login; two different communications are used.
However, check first <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI</SIGNAL> resistors, <RESISTOR>R4902</RESISTOR>-04.
Post <CHIP>U4910</CHIP> voltages, before and after login.
